Topic.Title: I just paid 2 bucks for a bottle of Coke at a supermarket store

Message.Msg: go to another store. Walmart is much cheaper (1.25 for 2 liter)

Topic.Title: I just paid 2 bucks for a bottle of Coke at a supermarket store

Message.Msg: Stores will charge as much as people are stupid enough to pay. Thats your answer.

Message.Title: KO
Message.Msg: Bought KO pre-split hoping for a pop in the price. I know, my bad. It's done nothing but go down in price just about every day since the split. Is it worth holding on to short term?

Message.Title: 3X volume
Message.Msg: what's up???

Message.Title: what's up with KO today
Message.Msg: down like almost 2%???

I dunno, I just used it as a buying opportunity...don't see any serious news...restructure of some southern operations and voted out a union in TX...all looks good to me...but hey that probably means sell.
Dont know if Scottrade streamer is screwed up, it now shows 92 mil volume, if accurate, that is a monumental increase. What the F is going on? I bought the close.
Ameritrade shows 98.5 million now...

Just checked my TD Ameritrade account and KO did in fact trade over 90 mil today, 99 mil and change including after hours. All I can see is options settling and assignments. 3 years ago, it had a volume of 124 mil. Maybe Buffett was buying today...LOL

My chart shows 62 million traded one day 3 years ago, which is the previous all time high. Your chart must be adjusted to reflect the 2 for 1 split... Ether way that is a lot of stock in one day...must have been some institutional profit taking...

Message.Title: High volume
Message.Msg: When I bought my shares a few months ago I noticed mutual funds were buying a lot of shares of KO. Well today they must have sold. Don't know where they are going but the money managers act like a herd. I prefer with my nickles and dimes to act like Warren Buffet.

Doubt it, I already checked. KO puts up very high volume on Q witching expiry days. It put up 124 mil on one of those days in 2009 and 65 mil last year on another Q witching friday. Business as usual IMO. No reason to sell a clear winner.
In SEP 2009, it traded 124 mil, another options friday. Business as usual.....

It only traded 62 million shares that day, at the the real price that day in the $53-54 range. Your chart probably has been back adjusted to account for the 2 for 1 split that occurred earlier this year and if so should show the daily price of half the amount I show... If what I say is correct, then your chart would show 135 million shares traded at a range in the $26-27 range, which is double the actual volume and half the actual price.

I typo-ed that volume it should read as follows: If what I say is correct, then your chart would show 124 million shares traded at a range in the $26-27 range, which is double the actual volume and half the actual price.

Topic.Title: The new flavor drops are Genius.

Message.Msg: Kraft beat them to it over a year ago. Not sure why they are going after this market. Millions of people already use the MIO ($100 mil in sales of MIO is the evidence). Dansani better blow the MIO out of the water. DOnt see that happening at all. Will try Dansani though...Love the MIO.
one word: Options
Anyone here considering the rebalancing of the indexes as a possibility for the drop?? That would account for the huge volume. KO will be right back to over $39 in a flash, LOL
Some bank was going to unload a boat load of KO. Wonder if that is what happening?

If your scenario is true, and normal daily volume is about 14 mil and 100 mil was traded today, then it follows that about 80mil+ was unloaded...2.5% of float...only 3 other holders hold more than 2.5%...I would say that is a boatload. And it only went down less than 1.5%. LMFAO. Back to $39 next week....
